GSILib.BSystem

Interface EditorialOffice

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BusinessSystem, PublicBusinessSystem

    public interface EditorialOffice
    This interface retrieves the basic behaviour of an editorial office. It does support basic operations of introducing, retrieving and listing the most basic information in the System

    • Method Summary

        Adds a journalist to the office
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if it was correctly added, false if it was null or already existing

        Parameters:
        jr - The journalist
        Returns:
        true if it exist, false if it was null or non-existing

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • addPrize

        boolean addPrize(Document d,
                 java.lang.String prize)
        Adds a string-represented prize to a given document, which can be a Teleprinter, WebNew or PrintableNew.
        Parameters:
        d - The new the prize is associated with.
        prize - the prize the document was awarded with
        Returns:
        true if the Document was already stored and it was correctly listed, false otherwise

      • removePrize

        boolean removePrize(Document d,
                    java.lang.String prize)
        Deletes a prize that has been associated with a given Document
        Parameters:
        d - The document itself
        prize - The prize to be deleted
        Returns:
        True if it was correctly deleted, false if it wasn't or did not exist.

        Returns:

      • getDocuments

        Retrieves all the documents in the system written by a journalist
        Parameters:
        j - Journalist to be inquiried
        Returns:
        An array of documents

      • getPrintableNewsFromAuthor

        PrintableNews[] getPrintableNewsFromAuthor(Journalist j)
        Retrives all the PrintableNews in the system written by a journalist (variant of getDocuments(j) method)
        Parameters:
        j - Journalist to be inquired
        Returns:
        An array of printable news

      • addReviewer

        boolean addReviewer(PrintableNews pn,
                    Journalist rw)
        Adds a journalist as reviewer of an existing news. If the news or the journalist did not exist in the system the operation must have no effect and return false.
        Parameters:
        pn - The printable news to which we are adding a reviewer.
        rw - The reviewer
        Returns:
        true if and only if (a) the news and the journalist existed, (b) the latter wasn't listed as a reviewer of the former, and (c) it was correctly added as such.

      • removeReviewer

        boolean removeReviewer(PrintableNews pn,
                       Journalist rw)
        Removes a reviewer from a given PrintableNews. If the PrintableNews did not exist in the system, the operation must have no effect and return false.
        Parameters:
        pn - printable news
        rw - reviewer to be removed
        Returns:
        true if and only if (a) the news and the journalist existed, (b) the latter was listed as a reviewer of the former, and (c) it was correctly removed.

      • listReviewers

        Journalist[] listReviewers(PrintableNews pn)
        Retrieves the list of Journalist that have revised a document
        Parameters:
        pn - The printable piece of news
        Returns:
        The list of journalists, or null if pn wasn't stored in the system

      • addPicture

        boolean addPicture(Picture p)
        Adds a picture to the system. Note that a Picture cannot be introduced twice.
        Parameters:
        p - The printable piece of news
        Returns:
        True if it could be added by the system, false otherwise.

      • removePicture

        boolean removePicture(Picture p)
        Remove a picture from the system
        Parameters:
        p - The picture to be removed
        Returns:
        true if it existed and was correctly removed from the system

      • getPictures

        Picture[] getPictures(Photographer p)
        Retrieves the pictures associated with a given photographer
        Parameters:
        p - The photographer
        Returns:
        A list of the pictures

      • getAuthor

        Photographer getAuthor(Picture p)
        Retrieves the information on the author of a Picture. If the Picture is not stored in the system, the result is null.
        Parameters:
        p - The picture
        Returns:
        The photographer associated with the picture

      • getWebResource

        WebResource getWebResource(java.lang.String URL)
        Retrieves a webResource (WebNews or Picture) from its URL. // UML?
        Parameters:
        URL - The URL
        Returns:
        The elemento, or null if no element matched the search.

        Returns:

      • getWebNews

        WebNews[] getWebNews()
        Returns the list of Webnews stored in the system

        a list of Webnews

      • getWebNews

        WebNews getWebNews(java.lang.String URL)
        Gets the WebNews associated to a given URL
        Parameters:
        URL - resource with a WebNews
        Returns:
        webnews requested.

      • getIndexedNews

        WebNews[] getIndexedNews(java.lang.String keyword)
        Returns all the WebNews in the system indexed by (an exact) keyword, up to upper/lower case matters.
        Parameters:
        keyword - The search term, which must be non-empty
        Returns:
        An array with the news.

      • createNewspaper

        boolean createNewspaper(java.util.Date d)
        Create a newspaper for the specified date
        Parameters:
        d - The ¿¿data?? of the newspaper. The system only allows one single newspaper per Date
        Returns:
        true if and only if the paper was correctly created.

      • createNewspaper

        boolean createNewspaper(java.lang.String date)
        Creates a Newspaper for the specified date given in String format
        Parameters:
        date - String to be converted into Date
        Returns:
        true if and only if the newspaper was correctly created

      • insertNewspaper

        Newspaper insertNewspaper(Newspaper newspaper)
        Adds a Newspaper to the system
        Parameters:
        newspaper - to be added to the System
        Returns:
        instance of a Newspaper

      • getNewspaper

        Newspaper getNewspaper(java.util.Date d)
        Retrieves the newspaper associated with a given date
        Parameters:
        d - The date
        Returns:
        The instance of JournalIssue for that date, or null if it does not exist.

      • getNewspaper

        Newspaper getNewspaper(java.lang.String d)
        Retrieves the newspaper associated with a given date
        Parameters:
        d - The string of a date
        Returns:
        The instance of JournalIssue for that date, or null if it does not exist.

      • getNewspapersByPartialKey

        Newspaper[] getNewspapersByPartialKey(java.lang.String date)
        Returns a list of Newspapers of a given date, which is the partial key
        Parameters:
        date - The date that filters the Newspapers
        Returns:
        a list of Newspapers which have the given date

      • getNewspapers

        Newspaper[] getNewspapers()
        Returns all the Newspapers.
        Returns:
        An array with the Newspapers of BusinessSystem.

      • deleteNewspaper

        boolean deleteNewspaper(java.util.Date d)
        Deletes the newspaper from a specified date.
        Parameters:
        d - The date for which the newspaper must be deleted
        Returns:
        true if newspaper is deleted correctly

      • addNewsToIssue

        boolean addNewsToIssue(Newspaper np,
                       PrintableNews pn)
        Adds a given news to a specific journal issue. In case the PrintableNews did not exist in the system, it must also be stored. However, if the JournalIssue did not exist in the system, the operation must have no effect and return a false result.
        Parameters:
        np - Issue at which the pn must be added
        pn - Printable news to be added to the journal issue
        Returns:
        true if and only if the printable news could be added to the journal issue.

      • getJournalist

        Journalist[] getJournalist(Newspaper np)
        Retrieves the list of journalist that have authored some document in a given JournalIssue
        Parameters:
        np - The journal issue for which we seek the Journalist list
        Returns:
        An array containing the journalists.

      • listPrizes

        java.lang.String[] listPrizes(Document d)
        Retrieves the array of prizes that a Document earned
        Parameters:
        d - The Document
        Returns:
        An array containing the prizes.

      • getPicture

        Picture getPicture(java.lang.String url)
        Retrieves the picture with that url
        Parameters:
        url - The picture's url
        Returns:
        The picture object.

      • getJournalistOptions

        java.lang.String getJournalistOptions()
        Creates an HTML fragment with a listing of selectable Journalists
        Returns:
        HTML fragment to be shown in a web page for the listing of Journalists

      • getNewspaperOptions

        java.lang.String getNewspaperOptions()
        Creates an HTML fragment with a listing of selectable Newspapers
        Returns:
        HTML fragment to be shown in a web page for the listing of Newspapers
